units.title: Tissue cleaning and crypt isolation
units.text: To clean the tissue and isolate fresh crypts for organoid generation, colon tissue was first sliced open lengthwise and wiped 3–4 times with gauze (Fisher Scientific) to remove waste and mucus. The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish filled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with 10 mM HEPES (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X GlutaMAX (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X Pen-Strep (Thermo Fisher Scientific), and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B (Thermo Fisher Scientific)). The epithelium was then minced from tissue segments using scalpels (Fisher Scientific) and collected into 50 mL conical tubes. Minced epithelium was washed 3 times with DMEM++ (Advanced DMEM/F12 (Thermo Fisher Scientific) supplemented with 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X Pen-Strep, and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B), and centrifuged at 4 °C, 500 × g for 3 min between each wash.
units.rationale: Describes the initial preparation of colon tissue and isolation of crypts for organoid culture.

units.title: EDTA digestion of tissue
units.text: After the final wash, tissue was resuspended in 25 mL of 2.5 mM EDTA in PBS and placed in an end-over-end rotator at 37 °C until crypts were visible, around 12 min.
units.rationale: Specifies the enzymatic digestion step that releases crypts from the tissue.

units.title: Embedding crypts in Matrigel
units.text: Once Matrigel had solidified for 30 min at 37 °C, crypts were fed with organoid growth media.
units.rationale: Details the step of embedding isolated crypts in Matrigel and initiating culture.

units.title: Organoid growth media formulation
units.text: Organoid growth media65: Advanced DMEM/F12 supplemented with 1X Pen-Strep, 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X B-27 Supplement, 0.2 nM Wnt Surrogate protein, 5 nM Gastrin-1, 1.25mM N-Acetyl-L-Cysteine, 10 mM Nicotinamide, 100 µg/mL Primocin, 500 nM A 83-01, 50 ng/mL recombinant human EGF, 100 ng/mL recombinant human Noggin, 250 ng/mL recombinant human R-spondin 3, 100 ng/mL recombinant human IGF1, 50 ng/mL recombinant human FGF2, and with 10 µM Y-27632.
units.rationale: Provides the complete composition of the medium used to support organoid growth.

units.title: Irradiation injury protocol
units.text: For irradiation studies, the plates were placed on the center of the rotating table of the (137Cs) gamma irradiator) for the time periods equivalent to either 6 Gy or 12 Gy, and then the organoids were further cultured in the incubator.
units.rationale: Outlines how ionizing radiation is applied to organoids as an injury model.

units.title: DSS treatment of organoids
units.text: For DSS treatment, DSS (MP Biomedicals) was dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide), and added to organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media. The low and high doses considered were 0.1% DSS and 0.5% (wt/vol) DSS in organoid media.
units.rationale: Describes the chemical injury (dextran sulfate sodium) applied to organoids.

units.title: Cytomix inflammatory stimulus
units.text: For cytomix treatment, human recombinant TNFɑ (R&D Systems), IFNɣ (R&D systems), and IL-1β (PeproTech) were dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide), and added to organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media.
units.rationale: Specifies the cytokine cocktail used to mimic inflammatory conditions.

units.title: Organoid passaging procedure
units.text: To passage, organoids were mechanically dislodged from Cultrex domes using a P1000 pipette tip and resuspended in cold 10 mM EDTA with 10 µM Y-27632 (STEMCELL Technologies) in a 15 mL conical tube. The tube containing organoids was then placed on an end-over-end rotator at 4 °C for 30 min and then centrifuged for 5 min at 500 ×g, 4 °C. Organoids were then resuspended in 1X Trypsin (Fisher Scientific) and placed in an end-over-end rotator for 6 min at 37 °C.
units.rationale: Details the mechanical and enzymatic steps for subculturing organoids.

units.title: FITC‑dextran permeability assay
units.text: FITC-Dextran (MedChemExpress) diluted to 2 mg/mL in PBS for 5 min in the incubator (37 °C, 5% CO2) for 30 min, after which organoid growth media with 10 µM Y-27632 was added.
units.rationale: Provides the protocol for assessing barrier integrity of organoids using fluorescent dextran.

units.title: Caspase‑3/7 apoptosis measurement
units.text: Organoids were incubated in CellEvent Caspase-3/7 Detection Reagent (Thermo Fisher) diluted in media according to manufacturer protocols for 30 min. Organoids were then washed with PBS and imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect fluorescence and DIC images. The % area of caspase was quantified using FIJI as the area of organoid stained positive for Caspase-3/7 divided by the total area of the organoid from DIC images.
units.rationale: Describes the fluorescent assay and quantification method for detecting apoptosis in organoids.
